intro: Gynocraterium, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy spathaceous inflorescence, which consists of a single, petal-like spathe enclosing a cluster of small, greenish flowers. The plants typically grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Gynocraterium species are known for their toxic properties, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals. Due to their ornamental value and ecological significance, some species are cultivated in gardens and wetlands.
